Mini 1445: Overly-Cheerful Moderator Mafia (Yayyyyyyy!)
Modded by Zoidberg.
Reviewed by xRECKONERx, LlamaFluff and petroleumjelly.


Players alive:
  1. jeremylu Equinox
  2. Green Crayons
  3. Gorgon Bacde
  4. Demon Baezu
  5. evilpacman18
  6. FourTrouble

Spoiler: Players dead
  1. Maenara, Town Jailkeeper
  2. Nachomamma8, Vanilla Townie
  3. DeasVail, Town Cop
  4. ChannelDelibird JacobSavage, Mafia Goon
  5. Elyse, Vanilla Townie
  6. BrightEyedFish Haschel Cedricson, Vanilla Townie
  7. Matias AngryPigeon, [color=#00FF00]Vanilla Townie[/color]


Game links, points of interest
  • Day 1 Begins
  • Haschel Cedricson replaces BrightEyedFish
  • Bacde replaces Gorgon
  • D1 lynch
  • Equinox Replaces Jeremylu
  • Jacob Savage replaces CDB
  • D3 starts
  • D4 starts
  • Baezu replaces Demon
  • D5 starts
  • Final vote count

Rules
  1. Obey all site-wide rules. Those can be found here.
  2. Play to your win condition! This is supposed to be fun!
  3. Use common sense. Note that I will be the judge of what constitutes common sense.
  4. Do not quote any private communications, and do not attempt to impersonate the mod. Modtext will be in Bold, rainbow font.
  5. Do not talk about this game outside of the game thread unless your role specifically allows it.
  6. Days will last 2 real weeks, and nights will last 3 real days.
  7. Lynching requires a simple majority of votes, e.g. VOTE: Zoidberg. Unvoting is not necessary but makes my job easier. Votes must be in bold or using the vote tags if you want them to be counted.
  8. A No-Lynch can occur by majority rule or if deadline hits.
  9. After you are dead you may make one “Bah!”-type post if you desire, but it must not contain game-relevant info.
  10. Do not edit or delete any posts if you have that ability.
  11. All text posted should be easily readable by everyone. No hidden-text shenanigans.
  12. 72-ish hours without posting = prod. 3 prods = replacement.
  13. Pretending to break a rule is the same as breaking it.
  14. If you wish to direct my attention to something, use bold text e.g. hey mod, you suck
  15. I reserve the right as the Mod to make any decisions about the game I want, and to add or modify rules as I see fit.

The following is a sample role PM. At least one player received this role:
Welcome to Mini 1445, Zoidberg! You are a Vanilla Townie.

You have no abilities other than your voice and your vote.

At no time may you privately communicate with any other player.

You win the game when all threats to the town are eliminated.

Please confirm your role via PM.

The game thread is here: viewtopic.php?f=2&t=27393
Role PMs are out, when I get 9/13 confirmed the game will start! Yee haw!

Day 1 begins! Wooo hoo!

With 13 alive, it's 7 to lynch.

Places! The show is about to start. Faces, beautiful.

No one ugly allowed!

Vote: Gorgon

VOTE: BrightEyedFish

All fish I've seen have dark eyes.
Elyse, who do you think I should vote for?
Yourself

http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=w0b01wc_Htc

VOTE: Nachomamma8

Why helo thar.
Hi. This is a Mafia game. I'm making my RVS vote. Vote: ChannelDelibird. I haven't done this in months.

VOTE: DeasVail

Poor form to ask for advice on page one.

I guess I'm not voting until page two then.

Crayons are so mean sometimes.

In post 10, Matias wrote:Hi. This is a Mafia game. I'm making my RVS vote. Vote: ChannelDelibird. I haven't done this in months.

Welcome back...
VOTE: Matias

VOTE: BrightEyedFish

Gut.
Vote BrightEyed
That wagon's ok I suppose.

In post 12, DeasVail wrote:I guess I'm not voting until page two then.

Crayons are so mean sometimes.



In post 16, DeasVail wrote:That wagon's ok I suppose.


These are really weak, careful statements. Not even about the "Who should I vote for", because that means nothing, but that's really a weak thing to say about the BEF wagon

Unvote, Vote: DeasVail

I agree with Matias.

VOTE: DeasVail
Really? I feel like DV is playing a better game already than the last time I played with him.

In post 19, evilpacman18 wrote:Really? I feel like DV is playing a better game already than the last time I played with him.


I've never played a game with him to my recollection. I hate to ask for meta now but do you have a link? It'll at least kickstart this game for me.

I am comfortable with leaving my vote where it is to see what, if anything, comes of this young bandwagon.


pacman: Are you saying that DV is a bad player?

Matias, how were my statements worse than your own, and what are you looking to get out of a link to one of my past games? (I think a fair bit of EPM's last game with me was lost in the crash)

Gorgon, is 18 supposed to be hypocritical?

Crayons, I'm pretty sure he is.

In post 22, DeasVail wrote:Gorgon, is 18 supposed to be hypocritical?


I see what you did there. Well, at least I voted.
Is it necessary to vote during RVS, gorgon?

random vote

VOTE: Brighteyed

In post 22, DeasVail wrote:Matias, how were my statements worse than your own, and what are you looking to get out of a link to one of my past games? (I think a fair bit of EPM's last game with me was lost in the crash)

Gorgon, is 18 supposed to be hypocritical?

Crayons, I'm pretty sure he is.


Because I made one post with an RVS vote, made on a person simply because I knew them the best. You acknowledged a wagon, said it was "ok", didn't even make an attempt to analyze it further or put pressure anywhere on top of the post that you made as a really thinly veiled omgus against someone who contested your first post (granted I think he's way off the mark but it's your reaction that counts)

There's really no comparison between your posts and mine, since mine is no different than any other RVS in this game, while yours has slight meaning behind it. It's not much to go on but you're the scummiest one here at the moment.

I also don't remember playing with you at all so if I know this is how you start out a game as town, it could lead to organizing my train of thought this early in the game.
This is the most recent town game that I didn't replace into.

The thinly veiled OMGUS thing is really silly. First, there's nothing scummy about OMGUS, and second, it wasn't even OMGUS.

Why would I analyse it when it's only just begun?

And regarding pressure, I guess I could have voted for Fish, but apart from that, a vote for someone wouldn't have been at all serious and very likely wouldn't have pressured at all.

I guess I just compare it to RVS posts I make when I'm scum. I make really careful, weak statements in order to try to fit in, because very surprisingly, there is a LOT of information you can get from the first few pages in hindsight while you're nearing the end of the game. I try to seek them out at first and refer back to them for clues.

It's just really weird when you sit there and say "This wagon is okay." without making an action on it or a stronger statement if you were 1. serious about RVS ending and 2. serious about trying to find scum in general and cared less about fitting in, because fitting in is not what RVS is about. I'm not explicitly stating you need to straight up pressure someone to the brink of heated debate, but a little bit of pushing shows that you want to kick this game off and hunt scum.

My point about the OMGUS is that on the surface, it's extremely light hearted finger pointing. But I read it as either a straight up extremely weak deflection aimed at something that you aren't sure is serious or not or something that you could say in order to reflect attention back towards him without calling attention to yourself. As I said before, it's not much to go on but it's what I have so far and I wanted to kickstart this game and get it moving somehow.
Reading your game now though, I forgot you posted it, apologies.

Yeah, my point is that the Crayons comment wasn't related to him being scum or town.

I didn't really think anyone was scummy and didn't have anything that I wanted to push on at that point.

PEdit: Don't feel like you need to. It's only if you want it.

Duly noted. I'm taking a look and it seems somewhat similar to this game but you were quick with the theories in that game. Page two.

Can we get others' comments on current happenings?:

1. BrightEyedFish's wagon
2. Arguments against DeasVail
3. Gorgon's agreement with me and EPM's disagreement

Really? I thought I was pretty different there.

Especially since you think I could be focused on fitting in here, and I really don't think you could have made that argument there.

Somewhat similar. Had I not brought up anything, we could have observed how you were going to act, but it's a moot point now. I asked for meta last page anyway. Your self-admission that the beginning of this game is different is making me feel better about you though but I'm still not completely convinced (hence the request in #32. Haven't heard much from everyone yet)

I don't think that bold statement last game that got a wagon placed on you was "trying to fit in" FWIW, if that's what you were referring to. That's what I was as well, so I agree with you.

Waiting on others' feelings at this point.

In post 34, Matias wrote:I don't think that bold statement last game that got a wagon placed on you was "trying to fit in" FWIW, if that's what you were referring to. That's what I was as well, so I agree with you.

Why did you mention the 'quick theories' (which is something that can easily vary between games) and not this?

They're one in the same. You placed a vote very early on that seemed brash to a lot of the playerbase (one person in particular mentioned WIFOM). It seemed to come out of nowhere and it created a wagon on you.

No such "brash"ness showed up in the first page of this game and so I noted that other than the fact that you were quick with a vote in that game, you seemed to start out both games with the same light attitude and "joking around".

Despite everything said so far, I expected something a lot more serious than what you placed in #16 of this game.

I really hope I'm making myself clear. I hate using meta, but EPM brought up something I felt I needed to check out (I refer back to how important the first few pages of the game are in endgame hindsight)
Deas, what did you mean that the BrightEyed wagon was okay?

I thought his post was possibly scummy, but not so much that I wanted to make a big deal out of it.

Matias, you are making yourself clear and thanks for the explanation. I'm still surprised you didn't find my play between the games more different, but I don't think you're scum.
EPM, what about my play at that point did you think was better?

Deadline is 30 April at 5pm Pacific Time.
DV, how is something "possibly" scummy?

In post 41, FourTrouble wrote:DV, how is something "possibly" scummy?

It could be slightly scummy or it could just be me trying too hard to find scum on page one.

In post 24, Elyse wrote:Is it necessary to vote during RVS, gorgon?


Let me put it like this.

In accepted mafia theory people should use their votes as votes are what the game is about. It's the mechanism of the game while everything else is 'just' words that don't have much effect on game flow as the votes. Of course this goes together but there is a reason why Tree Stump is a role. That article even says that "In essence, they are a dead player who can still post in the game thread."

I don't see any reason for breaking this principle in RVS.

In post 32, Matias wrote:1. BrightEyedFish's wagon


Four votes in RVS for no reason? I don't think I've seen anything like it so I'm not sure what to make of it.

In post 42, DeasVail wrote:
In post 41, FourTrouble wrote:DV, how is something "possibly" scummy?

It could be slightly scummy or it could just be me trying too hard to find scum on page one.



There's no such thing as trying too hard early game as it's expected that the votes are usually just light prodding, so you should not be holding back like that.
Vote: Gorgon
RVS wagons can always be commented on. Why the sarcasm?

In post 44, DeasVail wrote:Vote: Gorgon


Why?

In post 45, Matias wrote:RVS wagons can always be commented on. Why the sarcasm?


I didn't mean to be sarcastic and I'm not sure why you read that into my comment. And I did comment on it but I would like to add though that I'm not seeing how BEF's first post is scummy or even possibly scummy; like I said, I see it as voting for no or pretty much no reason in all cases. The whole issue leaves me pretty confused.
I also have no idea why my post was scummy.  But I do not trust the last two votes on my wagon...

Gorgon, it's mostly your suggestion that my lack of vote was scummy, followed by your explanation which really isn't very relevant to RVS and is not relevant to scum or town motivations either. It feels like you've tried too hard in 43 to back up your previous comment, while it doesn't actually make sense as one could just as easily say that unless used to lynch, votes have no use at all.

Another thing is that you quote Matias' request specifically, only to not say anything about it at all. When compared to your lack of comment on how my latest posts affect your read of me, which is obviously another big issue, I think it makes you scummy.

The fact that you quote Matias' post means that you aren't town seeking to avoid sharing their thoughts. Town with that intention would not answer only to say they don't know what to make of it.
But then, if you are prepared to be open about your thoughts, it means you aren't really scumhunting either, as I have made a lot of new posts since your vote, which should affect your read on me in some way, whether making it stronger or weaker I don't know.

I admit that this is all pretty weak though.

Re: The DV wagon - I can see why it happened, though my experience of DV means I wouldn't have voted (I often find him slightly off-chord from the rest of the game), and Matias looks town out of it. No particular read on DV currently.

In post 47, BrightEyedFish wrote:I also have no idea why my post was scummy. But I do not trust the last two votes on my wagon...


Why?

Unvote. I nothing the DV/Matias exchange, which does little to encourage my continued vote when I'm looking for persons who actively raise my suspicions. I look forward to revisiting that exchange within the context of future play to better cement my feelings on the matter.


jeremylu: Did you not care that your "random vote" put a bandwagon over the halfway point to a lynch, or did you just not bother to look at the first page of activity before voting? Or is there a secret third option that paints you in a better light? Because only Options 1 and 2 come to my mind.


Gorgon: Can you please explain what you meant by post 23?

Green, you're forgetting the important bit: The stating that this is a random vote, in order to ensure that he gets as little attention as possible.

Let's give him that:

[voteJeremylu[/vote]

...

VOTE: Jeremylu, even.

In post 48, DeasVail wrote:Gorgon, it's mostly your suggestion that my lack of vote was scummy, followed by your explanation which really isn't very relevant to RVS and is not relevant to scum or town motivations either. It feels like you've tried too hard in 43 to back up your previous comment, while it doesn't actually make sense as one could just as easily say that unless used to lynch, votes have no use at all.


I still stand by my opinion that a player who doesn't vote is considerably less useful than one who does - and one could definitely not 'just as easily say that unless used to lynch, votes have no use at all'. That's pretty poor mafia theory IMO.

In post 48, DeasVail wrote:Another thing is that you quote Matias' request specifically, only to not say anything about it at all.


I liked the fact that Matias asked these direct questions as it's a good way to keep the game moving, so I decided to make use of that fact by answering them. However, I found that the one I quoted was the only one that was really relevant to me as both of the others were about stuff that I was involved with myself. Maybe I could have given more thought to my answer though, and I did do that later on.

In post 48, DeasVail wrote:When compared to your lack of comment on how my latest posts affect your read of me, which is obviously another big issue, I think it makes you scummy.

The fact that you quote Matias' post means that you aren't town seeking to avoid sharing their thoughts. Town with that intention would not answer only to say they don't know what to make of it.
But then, if you are prepared to be open about your thoughts, it means you aren't really scumhunting either, as I have made a lot of new posts since your vote, which should affect your read on me in some way, whether making it stronger or weaker I don't know.


Frankly, big wall-to-walls like you and Matias were involved in on the last page are a perfect way to make my skim over stuff so I focused on the fact that you hadn't voted yet and your passiveness which I saw as something of a general pattern in your posts. It's a simplification for sure but I'm a big picture player.

In post 50, Green Crayons wrote:Gorgon: Can you please explain what you meant by post 23?


It is true that it was sort of hypocritical of me to vote DV for being passive while the only reasoning I gave was 'I agree with Matias', but I also suggested that it was less passive to vote than to not vote.

In post 49, ChannelDelibird wrote:
In post 47, BrightEyedFish wrote:I also have no idea why my post was scummy. But I do not trust the last two votes on my wagon...

VOTE: Brighteyed

and here is the preceding vote on me:

In post 15, FourTrouble wrote:Vote BrightEyed


That's it, nothing else. Just a quick BW vote with no reasoning at all, not even an "I agree with..." vote.

Both of these votes are bad, even if RVS was still going on.

UNVOTE:

BEF: I disagree. Those votes can be just as random and just as meaningless as the ones on the first page. There are plenty of games where people just throw in a reply as an RVS vote without reading.

That doesn't absolve them though. I've seen plenty of scum do it but it doesn't necessarily mean that. I think you're putting too much stock into those two votes in other words

As a side note, I feel Gorgon town at the moment.

I'd like to refrain from making judgments on jeremy's vote until he's responded.

In post 53, Gorgon wrote:Frankly, big wall-to-walls like you and Matias were involved in on the last page are a perfect way to make my skim over stuff so I focused on the fact that you hadn't voted yet and your passiveness which I saw as something of a general pattern in your posts. It's a simplification for sure but I'm a big picture player.
Your vote came before the Page Two "wall-to-walls." How are they relevant to your vote? (The answer, you appear to be saying, is that the wall-to-walls discussion is not relevant to your vote.) So my follow up question: why is your comment about wall-to-walls discussion actually relevant -- as opposed to, say, being used to try to handwave away having to provide critical commentary about the largest player-to-player interaction available (especially when that interaction is hardly walls of text)?



In post 54, Gorgon wrote:It is true that it was sort of hypocritical of me to vote DV for being passive while the only reasoning I gave was 'I agree with Matias', but I also suggested that it was less passive to vote than to not vote.
That's what I thought. So you think the only thing that should keep a person from voting for you -- because your conduct is admittedly otherwise identical to a person you find adequately scummy to vote for -- is the fact that you actually put a vote down?



Also:
In post 43, Gorgon wrote:
In post 42, DeasVail wrote:
In post 41, FourTrouble wrote:DV, how is something "possibly" scummy?
It could be slightly scummy or it could just be me trying too hard to find scum on page one.
There's no such thing as trying too hard early game as it's expected that the votes are usually just light prodding, so you should not be holding back like that.
I triple quoted here for context.

Can you further explain your comment that there is "no such thing as trying too hard early game"? It appears that you're chiding a person for having self-doubt about suspicions on Page One.

In post 55, BrightEyedFish wrote:
In post 25, jeremylu wrote:random vote

VOTE: Brighteyed


Even if this vote was on someone else I would still be suspicious. Just did not seem so "random" at that stage considering I already had 3 other votes on me.


This seems contradictory. You're saying you think he deliberately put you at four votes while trying to pretend it was random, but that if he had voted for anyone else (i.e. hadn't put someone at four votes in this way) it would still be suspicious?

Nothing wrong with a bandwagon vote, either.

Why aren't you voting for anyone?
Ohhhh hang on, I've just realised what you meant (i.e. if he'd put someone else on four, so it's not an OMGUS thing).

In post 43, Gorgon wrote:
In post 24, Elyse wrote:Is it necessary to vote during RVS, gorgon?


Let me put it like this.

In accepted mafia theory people should use their votes as votes are what the game is about. It's the mechanism of the game while everything else is 'just' words that don't have much effect on game flow as the votes. Of course this goes together but there is a reason why Tree Stump is a role. That article even says that "In essence, they are a dead player who can still post in the game thread."

I don't see any reason for breaking this principle in RVS.

I don't like how you automatically go to theory here and link me to the wiki for a tree stump. (WTF?) I know what a stump is. I wanted your opinion. Not the wiki's.

But I understand you think it's better to put votes down. I was asking because you're comment "at least I voted" seemed off to me.
In post 55, BrightEyedFish wrote:
In post 49, ChannelDelibird wrote:
In post 47, BrightEyedFish wrote:I also have no idea why my post was scummy. But I do not trust the last two votes on my wagon...

That's it, nothing else. Just a quick BW vote with no reasoning at all, not even an "I agree with..." vote.

Both of these votes are bad, even if RVS was still going on.

UNVOTE:

Yeah, this is not good. How are those bad RVS vote? Bandwagons often lead out of RVS and into the actual game. And what makes those votes worse than the other RVS votes, besides the fact that they are bandwagon votes?

Also why the unvote?

It kind of seems like DV intended his first few posts to sound the way they did - a reaction test of sorts? The reason behind this is his 22 - it feels like DV's genuinely trying to hunt scum off the wagon that formed because of his former posts. That coupled with how I don't think scum would have the audacity to open up in a manner as to draw attention to themself makes me think town.

I want to call Matias town for how natural his logic sounds and for its thoroughness, but that sounds kind of naive.

Don't like Gorgon's 43. The first and last part of his explanations in that post sound too excessive.
Unvote, Vote: Gorgon

Maenara - I think you're reading too much into it. That's really no way stay inconspicuous.
i looked at a list of players, random.org, then found brighteyed. i cant really keep up and read all this.

In post 58, Green Crayons wrote:
In post 53, Gorgon wrote:Frankly, big wall-to-walls like you and Matias were involved in on the last page are a perfect way to make my skim over stuff so I focused on the fact that you hadn't voted yet and your passiveness which I saw as something of a general pattern in your posts. It's a simplification for sure but I'm a big picture player.
Your vote came before the Page Two "wall-to-walls." How are they relevant to your vote? (The answer, you appear to be saying, is that the wall-to-walls discussion is not relevant to your vote.) So my follow up question: why is your comment about wall-to-walls discussion actually relevant -- as opposed to, say, being used to try to handwave away having to provide critical commentary about the largest player-to-player interaction available (especially when that interaction is hardly walls of text)?


I was responding to DV's statement that his latest posts, after I voted, should have affected my read on him by explaining how I read those posts. Neither he nor myself mentioned my vote so I have no idea where you're going with this.

Regarding the handwave accusation, I don't see anybody else going over this stuff to provide 'critical commentary'. These kinds of back-and-forth between players, no matter what you call them, are usually not good for gameflow and don't often provide reads, or at least not juicy ones. You yourself ignored it and got things back on track by asking DV a simple question.

In post 58, Green Crayons wrote:

That's what I thought. So you think the only thing that should keep a person from voting for you -- because your conduct is admittedly otherwise identical to a person you find adequately scummy to vote for -- is the fact that you actually put a vote down?


Where did I say or even suggest that I was dissuading people from voting me? I think my explanation that you're quoting there makes it abundantly clear what that post was all about.

VOTE: Green Crayons

And a hearty WTF? to you as well.

1) The link I provided states no opinions but was merely for reference.

2) My opinion is grounded in theory so there's no separating them and to expect me to do so is absurd.

3) What bearing does this dislike of the answer I gave you have bearing on my alignment, if any?

In post 62, Demon wrote:Don't like Gorgon's 43. The first and last part of his explanations in that post sound too excessive.

3) What bearing does this dislike of the answer I gave you have bearing on my alignment, if any?

1. Ok. I phrased what I said wrong. Your answer was very fluffy and used unnecessary theory, and linking to the wiki was SO EXTRA.
2. Absurd? Really? I was looking for a simple "yes" or "no" but your answer was extremely over justified.
3. Did I ever say it affected my read on you? No.

However, your jumpiness, over-justification, and overall fluffy posting is making me suspicious of you. That, coupled with your bad vote on GC and even worse FoS on Demon is making you worthy of my vote.

UNVOTE: BrightEyedFish
VOTE: Gorgon

Gorgon, can you stop posting fluff? this does not help. can you combine you're posts, and not have 2 posts one minute apart?!?!?

FoS:Gorgon

Why?

jeremylu wrote:Gorgon, can you stop posting fluff? this does not help. can you combine you're posts, and not have 2 posts one minute apart?!?!?

Unvote, Vote: jeremylu. Never mind, this guy is scum.

Really sheepy statement. Ignored inquiries towards his RVS vote. Ignoring everything pretty much. FoSing but not voting...why? Especially since your original vote was random?

This is an extremely serious vote intended to lynch.

Gorgon read has not changed. I think the jeremy FoS is an attempt to throw further dirt on Gorgon. He's not making himself very articulate and it's creating malice towards himself.

Not sure what to think about the other people on Gorgon's wagon.

EPM isn't saying much. Watching him.

Maenara isn't saying much either.

In post 220, Elyse wrote:Your conclusion that Demon is informed by calling an off-base statement a reaction test is flawed. Weird statements don't necessarily come from scum.

I never said all weird statements come from scum. I do think people who post total nonsense are more likely to be scum than town but that doesn't mean I think weird statements come from scum. I'm talking about basic psychology and probability.

If a player interprets strange behavior as a reaction test, it means there is no explanation or alternative town motivation for that behavior other than calling it a reaction test. The reason this is more likely to come from scum than town, is because of the certainty the player with strange behavior is town despite strange behaviors that have no clear town motivation. I also think, on a basic psychological level, that scum are more likely to be looking for reaction tests than town. This goes along with scum more likely to be self-conscious, more likely to be worried someone is targeting them (EPM), etc. That's social psychology 101.

To be clear, I'm talking about what is probable. I'm sure you can find examples of townies doing everything and anything that scum do. Matias says townies interpret strange behavior as reaction tests all the time. I'm sure they do. What matters in this game, ultimately, is the probability that something comes from town compared with the probability that it comes from scum. Context matters, too.

I think I understand what your saying, but I'm not sure if I agree with the conclusion. Nevertheless, I think you've inspired me to go down this path. CDB declared three possible people that he would hide behind - me, EPM, and Gorgon/Bacde. If all three of us are town, then scum would almost certainly target one of those three in the hopes of getting a double kill. If there IS scum in the group of three, then the following scenarios are possible:

1) Mafia kill one of the three, and hit CDB at the same time. Obviously this is the best-case scum scenario.
2) Mafia kill one of the three, and CDB hides behind scum and dies. There are now two people with at least a 50% chance of being scum. This is the worst-case scum scenario.
3) Mafia kill somebody else (like Nacho), CDB hides behind town. CDB's claim isn't confirmed, and no information can be deduced about any of the three. Not a bad scenario for scum.
4) Mafia kill somebody else (like Nacho), CDB hides behind scum and dies. We know there is a scum in the group of three, but the base probability is as low as 33%. Not a GREAT scenario for scum, but nowhere near as bad as the worst case scenario

So, if CDB is telling the truth about being a hider, then at least one of myself, EPM and Bacde are scum. Except he hid behind me, so we can narrow it down to either EPM or Bacde.

If CDB is lying, then I suppose it doesn't really give us any information. Obviously I'm a little biased because if his claim is true then I am confirmed town, which makes things a lot easier for me.

Now it's Question Time! This one goes out to both EPM and Bacde. I am the vigilante*. I am going to shoot you tonight*. Convince me why I should shoot the other one.

Cop/JK at the core of this game is weird. Would Cop/JK vs 3 goons be balanced? mmmm. I tend to think no despite those PRs both being big since they odnt particularly gel well together. Doc/Cop is a big combo BUT the JK in the mix makes the cop getting RB'd after a claiming pretty likely despite the cop/doc combo. Also the jk can block the doc which is some more negative utility on that. And the doc in the mix makes a jk less able to clear via blocking scum.

Cop/JK/Hider is a hell of a setup. JK can't interfere with the hider. The hider's alibi can check out if investigated by cop (no result on inv). And I can't think of any great scum power to counter this. Hiders are very difficult to counter and a RC vs those 3 is probably not enough. An RB would be weird given the JK but not out of the picture altogether. A GF would be possible but also only mitigates one of the 3 big PRs. So I tend to doubt hider/cop/jk is the setup unless scum have multiple PRs (unlikely, but possible) or there is just an RB (and srsly that feels like a wacky setup).

On the other hand, I can see Doc/Cop/JK. Doc/JK give a moderate chance to make it to odds with 2 protects/blocks. The Prs step on each other a bit more than the alternative which feels more balanced to me in this case. Scum probably still has a PR and I would easily buy GF/RB/RC as that PR.

In post 1114, Haschel Cedricson wrote:This is completely unrelated to the game. GC, what is your opinion on Maryland v. King? Do you know what my favorite Supreme Court quote is?
I actually just had this conversation, so I will quote myself:

I agree that the majority holding is good as a policy point. Who doesn't want cold cases solved more frequently? And, yes, there is a minimal intrusion on the individual's Fourth Amendment privacy interests.

My problem with the holding is with how the majority is manipulating 4A jurisprudence. The taking of the DNA is very much an investigative search with the hope to criminally prosecute -- the notion that it is used in a functionally equivalent manner to the identifying procedures of fingerprinting ignores the reality of the situation. But the PC that the majority held to sanction the search (that the defendant has committed "Serious" Crime X) is not actually related to the investigative object of that search (whether the defendant has committed any other crimes).

It is, at bottom, a suspicion-less search with the goal to prosecute based on the fruits of that search.
And, would love to hear favorite SCOTUS quotes.  So many to choose from.
